question: [File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Medium - Large Pairs Array] Can processing 10,000+ validator commitments in a single straus() call cause stack overflow when prep_bits/prep_tables allocate large vectors?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Low - Allocation Timing] Does the vec![G::identity(); size] allocation on line 15 take time proportional to the window size, leaking window parameter through timing?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - Zeroization Timing] Do groupings.zeroize() and tables.zeroize() on lines 47-48 take time proportional to data size, potentially leaking information?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Medium - No Resource Cleanup] Does straus_vartime() drop groupings and tables without explicit zeroization, leaving scalars in allocator memory?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Critical - Point Addition Correctness] Can group addition (accum += pair.1) on line 18 produce incorrect results due to exceptional cases (identity, negation)?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - Doubling Correctness] Does res.double() on line 38 correctly implement point doubling for all group elements, including identity and points of small order?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Addition Commutativity] Does the addition order on line 43 (res += tables[s][...]) affect the final result? Can non-commutative operations break correctness?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Medium - Identity Handling] When res is None and groupings[s][b] is 0, does line 72 correctly skip or handle the identity element?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Off-by-One in Loop] Does the loop range 1..tables[p].len() on line 17 correctly compute all table entries, or does it miss index 0 or overflow at len()?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Medium - u8 to usize Cast] On line 43, can usize::from(groupings[s][b]) cause issues on platforms where usize is smaller than expected table size?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Window Type Safety] Is window: u8 always safe for 2^window calculation, or can window=64 on 32-bit systems cause unexpected behavior?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Low - Option Unwrap Safety] Is unwrap_or_else(G::identity) on line 78 always safe, or are there cases where this default is incorrect?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Medium - Thread Safety] Are groupings and tables on lines 31-32 thread-safe? Can concurrent straus() calls share mutable state?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Low - Mutation Safety] Does prep_tables() mutate any shared state, or is it pure and safe for concurrent execution?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Medium - Reentrant Safety] Can straus_vartime() be called recursively without causing stack overflow or corruption?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [High - Panic on Empty Pairs] Does prep_tables() panic when pairs.len() is 0, leaving calling code in inconsistent state?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Panic Leaves Secrets] If line 38 or 43 panics, are groupings and tables zeroized by drop handlers, or do secrets leak?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [Medium - Unwrap Safety] Does line 78's unwrap_or_else handle all cases correctly, or can it mask errors that should propagate?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Low - Vector Growth] Can Vec::push() on line 13 reallocate and fail, causing panic without proper cleanup?

[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Groupings Index Safety] Is groupings[s][b] on line 43 always in-bounds, or can s >= groupings.len() or b >= groupings[s].len() cause panic?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Tables Index Safety] Is tables[s] on line 43 always in-bounds, or can s >= tables.len() cause panic during multiexp?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus_vartime()] [High - Double Index Safety] Does line 70 perform two unchecked indices (tables[s] then [usize::from(...)]) that could both fail?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: prep_tables()] [Medium - Table Length Assumption] Does line 19 assume tables[p].len() == 2^window always holds, or can it be violated?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [Critical - Reverse Iteration] Does iterating b from high to low on line 35 correctly implement Straus algorithm, or should it be forward?
[File: crypto/multiexp/src/straus.rs] [Function: straus()] [High - Window Bit Ordering] Does processing windows in the order on lines 35-44 match the bit grouping order from prep_bits()?
